questions.question: What is the primary goal of Continuous Integration (CI)?
options: Frequently integrate code changes into a shared repository
questions.explanation: Continuous Integration aims to detect integration issues early by integrating changes frequently.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a version control system like Git?
options: To track and manage changes to source code over time
questions.explanation: Version control tracks changes, supports collaboration, and helps restore older versions when needed.

questions.question: Which statement best describes DevOps culture?
options: Developers and operations work separately with different goals
DevOps focuses on collaboration, shared responsibility, and continuous improvement
DevOps avoids automation to reduce risk
DevOps means no documentation is needed
questions.explanation: DevOps culture encourages collaboration and shared ownership to deliver reliable software faster.

questions.question: What does Infrastructure as Code (IaC) mean?
options: Buying physical servers for every deployment
Managing infrastructure using code and automation tools
Writing code only for frontend applications
questions.explanation: IaC uses code to provision and manage infrastructure consistently and repeatably.

questions.question: Why is planning important in DevOps?
options: It removes the need for automation
It helps teams align on priorities, deliverables, and timelines
questions.explanation: Planning helps teams decide what to build next and how to deliver it effectively.

questions.question: What is the main goal of Continuous Delivery?
options: Deploy every change to production automatically
Keep software in a deployable state with frequent reliable releases
Remove the need for version control
questions.explanation: Continuous Delivery ensures software is always ready to be released safely.

questions.question: How is Continuous Deployment different from Continuous Delivery?
options: Continuous Deployment automatically deploys changes to production after passing tests
Continuous Delivery always deploys automatically to production
questions.explanation: Continuous Deployment pushes every successful change directly to production.

questions.question: What does a Pull Request (PR) help with?
options: Requesting review and merging changes into the main branch
questions.explanation: Pull Requests allow team members to review and approve changes before merging.

questions.question: Which practice supports a strong DevOps culture?
questions.explanation: DevOps culture promotes collaboration, feedback, and shared responsibility.

questions.question: Why are automated tests important in Continuous Integration?
options: They catch issues early when changes are integrated
They remove the need for developers
questions.explanation: Automated tests detect problems early and keep the main branch stable.
